title: A Car-Lover’s Home Lists in Beverly Hills for $45 Million
text:
A newly built mansion in Beverly Hills, California, listed last week for $45 million.



The main house comprises five bedrooms and 10 bathrooms. A sprawling master bedroom comes with two adjoining bathrooms and walk-in closets.



Perhaps the biggest draw, though, at least for car collectors, is the house’s seven-car attached garage. Visitors—and owners—can drive their cars up a starlight quartzite driveway and enter the air conditioned space. Inside is a 58-foot wall animation and a turntable with surround sound, according to the listing.



Joel Danto

At the moment, the house is being shown with a limited edition 2019 White Aston Martin Vantage, a 2016 Ultraviolet Porsche GT3 RS, 2015 Blue McLaren 650S and a 1988 Red Ferrari Testarossa in the garage. Those cars are available to buy in a separate deal, according to a representative from Compass, the brokerage that’s handling the sale.

More: Shonda Rhimes Sells Los Angeles Home for $7.16 Million

The seller is developer Essam Ali, who bought the property in 2016 for $7.5 million through his development firm Royal Excel Enterprises Corp., records show. Building permits show that he demolished the existing house and poured about $2.21 million into erecting the main house and guest house, and installing the pool, with the design guidance of luxury residential home designer Roman James.

Mr. Ali referred media inquiries to the house’s brokers. Sally Forster Jones, Shauna Walters and Janet Muradian of Compass are all representing the house.



Completed this year, the 16,450-square-foot house comes with all of the newest home gadgets, including a security system, Lutron and Crestron lighting technology, and a Delos wellness system, which optimizes indoor air, water and light quality.

“The home provides the highest quality of water and air filtration as well as lighting technology to ensure the healthiest living environment,” Ms. Forster Jones said. “The holistic wellness ecosystem combines products, features, technologies and services to create and maintain indoor conditions that are designed to enhance health and well-being.”

The designer mansion also features a kitchen designed by Fendi, a living room boasting a Hermes chandelier, a gym, a wellness room with sauna and spa, a pool with swim-up bar, a wine cellar and elevator access.



“Aside from the stunning designer finishes, the build of the home is unlike any I have ever seen,” Ms. Forster Jones said. “All the materials are top-of-the-line and curated from around the globe. The stone and tile were meticulously selected from Antolini, Italy with every inch of the home being thoughtfully and tastefully crafted.”
